description: From Northern English dialectal and Scots haugh, from Northern Middle English *halgh, from Old English healh (“corner, nook”), from Proto-West Germanic *halh. Doublet of hale.

entries.meaning: (Scotland, Northern England, Ireland) A low-lying meadow by the side of a river.
examples: The cattle had  […]  loved their life in the haughs of Echt, south there across the uncouthy hills was a world cold and unchancy.
